title: Opening Remarks

author: Marc Dymetman, Xerox Research Centre Europe, Xerox

segmentation: Welcome to everybody to this workshop on prime knowledge for text and image processing.
Let me give you some context first.

This workshop is part of Pascal 2 automatic program, leveraging complex prior knowledge for learning Pascal Two is a network of excellence or European network accounts which started in March this year for five years and this is the first domestic program in this network.
There have been and are current also today.
Some workshops which.
Sponsored by this semantic program, ours is one of these workshops, and as you can see, there are five other workshops which have taken place, one of which is taking place today.
Nonparametric based workshop.
And another one which took place a few days ago on mining, learning and graphs.
So quickly too.
To go back to the two to see the schedule quickly.
OK, so we will start with an invited talk.
We are very honored to have person Mark Johnson giving this talk this morning and then we have a short poster preview where their sight fosters in this workshop.
So I've downloaded the previews on my laptop.
Please come to the floor.
Present your first because of the constraints on the schedule, we couldn't do the poster preview just before the posters themselves.
The posters are a bit later in the morning.
We have a coffee break and then we have a contributed talk and other invited talk and then we have the poster session.
And then lunch.
Um?
In the afternoon we have 1/3 invited talk.
And then two contributed talks.
Then a coffee break.
Then a panel.
And a last contributed talk.
So some things that have note doesn't out copy of the proceedings here.
Please take one if you want.
They also on the on the site of the workshop so you can look there.

We are going to record everything in this workshop, but if afterwards we can edit out if people do not feel comfortable to have this video recordings publicly available, please send send email to the to me and will.
We will not make them public, will not make it public.
Invited talks should last for 45 minutes, including questions.
5 minutes question is in minimum if you can make the talk.
If you can provide for people to ask questions for a longer time then please do.
If it is possible.
As for the contribute talks, they will be 20 minutes and five minutes questions.
And I say the poster preview will be from 950 to 10.
We have our posters just outside and they will be Co located with the NP nonparametric based workshop.
There are some posters which are related to that workshop.
Some presenters which are actually presenting in two in the two different workshops.
So it's just outside.
Um?
The panel will be from 4:30 to 5:30.
It is supposed to be interactive as all the sessions as all the talks here and also a bit controversial, we encourage a panelist to be controversial.
So I think this is would be the right attitude for the for the panel with.
OK, so now I leave the floor to Mark Johnson.
